alert.note: Alert for Dyer; Lauderdale; Tipton (Tennessee) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Memphis (Western Tennessee, Eastern Arkansas and Northern Mississippi)
info.headline: Severe Thunderstorm Warning issued March 30 at 3:16PM CDT until March 30 at 4:00PM CDT by NWS Memphis
info.description: The National Weather Service in Memphis has issued a * Severe Thunderstorm Warning for... Eastern Craighead County in eastern Arkansas... East central Poinsett County in eastern Arkansas... Mississippi County in eastern Arkansas... Southern Pemiscot County in southeastern Missouri... Southeastern Dunklin County in southeastern Missouri... Northern Tipton County in western Tennessee... Southwestern Dyer County in western Tennessee... Lauderdale County in western Tennessee... * Until 400 PM CDT. * At 316 PM CDT, severe thunderstorms were located along a line extending from 6 miles north of Gosnell to near Wilson, moving east at 35 mph. HAZARD...60 mph wind gusts. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Expect damage to roofs, siding, and trees. * Locations impacted include... Blytheville, Covington, Ripley, Osceola, Gosnell, Manila, Steele, Leachville, Caraway, Luxora, Wilson, Keiser, Fort Pillow State Park, Cardwell, Hornersville, Joiner, Arbyrd, Cooter, Dyess and Dell. HAIL THREAT...RADAR INDICATED MAX HAIL SIZE...<.75 IN WIND THREAT...RADAR INDICATED MAX WIND GUST...60 MPH
info.instruction: A Tornado Watch remains in effect until 800 PM CDT for eastern Arkansas...southeastern Missouri...and western Tennessee. For your protection move to an interior room on the lowest floor of a building. A Tornado Watch remains in effect until 800 PM CDT for eastern Arkansas...southeastern Missouri...and western Tennessee.
